My Mentor Profile

With 15+ years of experience at top tech companies like Amazon and Microsoft and other Fortune 500 companies, I'm able to identify blind spots in your career and advise you to address them.

Since 2020, I've conducted 200+ interviews, reviewed 500+ resumes, and mentored 100s of professionals worldwide to define their next step and execute on it.

I'm also the founder of mentory-sy.net, a free platform for mentoring Syrian professionals in Tech.

Don't navigate your career on your own, let me be your partner.

LinkedIn More About Me Start Mentoring

How I Can Help

Define Your Career Goal

We'll explore your background, identify options, and create a clear path forward that aligns with your aspirations, whether you're starting out or feeling stuck.

Find Focus in Tech

Navigate the shifting tech landscape by identifying in-demand roles that align with your strengths, from AI Engineering to Cloud Architecture.

Role Transitions

Get help switching roles with a clear breakdown of necessary technical and soft skills, plus an actionable transition plan tailored to your goals.

Earn Your Promotion

Build a promotion strategy with high-impact projects and align your work with your target seniority level, using proven techniques.

Build Your Brand

Improve your LinkedIn, GitHub presence, and craft a resume that captures attention from hiring managers and recruiters in a crowded market.

Interview Preparation

Get realistic mock interviews with actionable feedback from someone who's been on both sides of the table, with hire/no-hire assessments.

Common Questions

I'm offering my years of experience in building my career in the IT industry. I had to navigate multiple transformations in the industry with all the ambiguity that comes with. With my experience in Silicon Valley, I also have insights from the leaders who make industry shifts that may impact your career directly. I don't give generic advice. I share my actual path and apply it to your specific situation.

Your mentor is your long-term partner. Ideally they should have been in similar situations to yours or have already achieved what you aim to achieve in your near term future. The more exposed your mentor is to the industry, the better they can guide you. A good mentor should have proven credentials and success and not just be an influencer selling courses.

In fact, everyone should have mentor(s) for different stages of their professional lives. I personally have had the pleasure of working with multiple mentors. Looking for directions and advice from more senior people in your industry will enable you to see things from different perspectives, identify potential blockers in your career and address them. Most of my candidates are young professionals with fresh or a few years of experience, or mid-career professionals who are looking for a job change, role transition, interview prep for big tech, or building an online profile. If you are in one of these categories, we might be a good fit.
